suggestions: 3. Compelled Disclosures.  If Receiving Party or any of its Representatives are required by law, rule, regulation or legal proceeding (collectively, “Applicable Law”)  to disclose any Confidential Information, the Receiving Party will promptly notify the Disclosing Party of such pending disclosure so that the Disclosing party may seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy. The Receiving Party agrees to, and will cause its Representatives to, cooperate as reasonably requested by the Disclosing Party to obtain a protective order or other reasonable assurance that Confidential Information will be accorded confidential treatment. If, in the absence of a protective order, the Receiving Party or any of its Representatives are, on the advice of counsel, required by Applicable Law to disclose the Confidential Information, the Receiving Party or such Representatives may disclose only the part of the Confidential Information as is required to be disclosed; provided that the Receiving Party or such Representatives has provided the Disclosing Party with a reasonable opportunity to review and comment on such disclosure and use its or their commercially reasonable efforts to obtain assurance that the Confidential Information to be disclosed will be accorded confidential treatment. The Disclosing Party agrees that the Receiving Party and its Representatives may also disclose Confidential Information in the course of routine inspections, examinations or inquiries by federal or state regulatory agencies and self-regulatory organizations that have requested or required the inspection of records that contain Confidential Information; provided that the Receiving Party will, to the extent permitted by the relevant regulator, provide the Disclosing Party with notice of such disclosure as promptly as practicable.
originalTexts: 3. Compelled Disclosures.  If Receiving Party or any of its Representatives are required by law, rule, regulation or legal proceeding (collectively, “Applicable Law”)  to disclose any Confidential Information, the Receiving Party will promptly notify the Disclosing Party of such pending disclosure so that the Disclosing party may seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy. The Receiving Party agrees to, and will cause its Representatives to, cooperate as reasonably requested by the Disclosing Party to obtain a protective order or other reasonable assurance that Confidential Information will be accorded confidential treatment. If, in the absence of a protective order, the Receiving Party or any of its Representatives are, on the advice of counsel, required by Applicable Law to disclose the Confidential Information, the Receiving Party or such Representatives may disclose only the part of the Confidential Information as is required to be disclosed; provided that the Receiving Party or such Representatives has provided the Disclosing Party with a reasonable opportunity to review and comment on such disclosure and use its or their commercially reasonable efforts to obtain assurance that the Confidential Information to be disclosed will be accorded confidential treatment. The Disclosing Party agrees that the Receiving Party and its Representatives may also disclose Confidential Information in the course of routine inspections, examinations or inquiries by federal or state regulatory agencies and self-regulatory organizations that have requested or required the inspection of records that contain Confidential Information; provided that where such inspections, examinations or inquiries are primarily focused on the Disclosing Party or the potential Transaction, the Receiving Party will, to the extent permitted by the relevant regulator, provide the Disclosing Party with notice of such disclosure as promptly as practicable.
